Bringing the world together through live experiences
Eventbrite is a global self-service ticketing platform for live experiences that allows anyone to create, share, find and attend events that fuel their passions and enrich their lives. From music festivals, marathons, conferences, community rallies, and fundraisers, to gaming competitions and air guitar contests. Our mission is to bring the world together through live experiences.
2024 at a Glance
4.7M total events in nearly 180 countries
89M monthly average users
83M paid tickets

Best events in
Los Angeles
LA is a diverse sprawl of neighborhoods, but locals know there are tons of things to do. Wellness enthusiasts can take a yoga class, join a group meditation, or learn about Ayurveda. DIYers can make ramen or brew beer. Shoppers should swing by the various flea markets while cocktail lovers can mix up their own concoctions. Take your outings to the next level with these Los Angeles events.

Washington
Locals know that DC is more than just politics. Celebrate spring with a plethora of cherry blossom events or hit up a beer and wine festival to taste your way through the best offerings. Catch a community yoga class or party on a boat while listening to 90s hip hop. Learn to knit or take up beer-making. Take your outings to the next level with these DC events.

Meet the Britelings
Our team embodies the wide spectrum of events on Eventbrite-from musicians to marathon runners, foodies to fundraisers. What unites us? Our drive to help people get offline and get together to explore their interests and pursue new passions.
Sound up your alley?
Join us
.
Meet Our Leaders
Julia
Hartz
Co-Founder, Chief Executive Officer and Executive Chair
Julia is responsible for the vision, strategy, and growth of Eventbrite. Under         her leadership, the company has become a global ticketing and event technology platform that has         received multiple awards for workplace culture. These accolades include Fortune's 100 Best Workplaces in the         U.S., Glassdoor's Employees' Choice Best Places to Work, and San Francisco Business Times' Best Places to         Work in the SF Bay Area. Julia has been honored as one of Inc.’s Female Founders 100, Fortune’s 40 Under         40 business leaders, Inc.’s 35 Under 35, and Fortune’s Most Powerful Women Entrepreneurs.
Ted
Dworkin
Chief Product Officer
As Eventbrite’s Chief Product Officer, Ted is responsible for leading the company’s         global product management, design and research teams to drive innovation for event creators around the world.         Ted’s product career spans nearly three decades, with experience in consumer, B2B and enterprise businesses         as well as with platform ecosystems. Prior to joining Eventbrite, he served as Senior Vice President, Product         Management and Customer Experience at Sonos and also had a 20-year run at Microsoft where he helped build some         of the world’s best-known apps, websites, platform technologies and large-scale web services. Ted has         approached each role with the responsibility of marrying the art of product creation with the science of         applying data and technology to engage customers, create fans and grow profitable businesses.
Lauren
Danis
Chief Communications Officer
Lauren Danis brings over two decades of experience to Eventbrite where she serves         as the Chief Communications Officer overseeing the global integrated communications team which         includes both internal and external communications strategies.         Prior to Eventbrite, Lauren was the VP of Communications at Ancestry where she led all global         brand and product communications, social media and influencer relations. Lauren also spent over a decade         at leading global public relations firm Weber Shandwick where she worked on many of the firm’s marquee         accounts including Mondelēz International, Unilever, Motorola, Nestle, Abbott, and one of the most iconic         American campaigns in recent memory - “got milk?”         Early in her career, Lauren held communications roles at Hyatt, travel start-up e.Gulliver.com,         and Edelman after graduating from the esteemed Northwestern School of Communication and Media Studies.         Currently, she brings her integrated brand-building expertise to Eventbrite in an effort to help advance the         company vision and reputation amongst various stakeholders including Britelings, consumers, partners and investors.         In her spare time, you can find Lauren reading a good book, finding her zen on her yoga mat, taking a long walk         her husband and their two dogs, or experimenting in the kitchen with a new recipe.
Samantha
Wu
Chief Marketing Officer
Samantha Wu is the Chief Marketing Officer for Eventbrite, where she leads the strategic         direction of the company’s marketing initiatives, as it evolves into a consumer destination for event discovery.         With over 20 years of marketing experience, Samantha has held senior roles across major companies such as Meta,         Visa, and American Express. Prior to joining Eventbrite, she served as the CMO of Braintrust, the first         decentralized talent network, overseeing brand, product, and growth marketing. At Meta/Facebook, she led         global consumer brand and product marketing for the Facebook App, launching Facebook’s first brand campaign,         “More Together.” Her teams have been recognized with numerous global advertising awards, including Bronze         Lions at Cannes, Shorty Awards, and Clio Awards for exceptional social content and campaigns. Samantha holds         a BA in Economics and Asian Studies from Tufts University, a Master of International Affairs from Columbia University,         and a Degree in Occupational Studies from Le Cordon Bleu Culinary Arts.
Anand
Gandhi
Chief Financial Officer
Anand Gandhi is the Chief Financial Officer for Eventbrite. Most recently, Anand was Chief         Financial Officer at Viator, the world's leading marketplace for travel experiences, where he helped transform         the financial performance of the business, driving record revenue growth while achieving profitability. Previously,         he served as CFO of Skillshare, an online learning platform and two-sided marketplace, where he also oversaw record         revenue growth and led multiple rounds of equity and debt fundraising. Prior to Skillshare, Anand held financial,         strategic and operational leadership roles across the consumer entertainment landscape, including at The Walt Disney         Company, 21st Century Fox, Viacom and Time Inc., after beginning his career in investment banking at Morgan Stanley.
Anand has a B.A. in Economics from Columbia University. He also serves on the board of directors of New_ Public,         a non-profit R&D lab reimagining social media.
Lisa
Gorman
General Counsel
Lisa oversees the legal function at Eventbrite -- including product, privacy and regulatory         compliance, commercial contracts, litigation, employment, and corporate matters -- as well as         Marketplace Policy. Lisa began her career as a Clerk for United States District Court Magistrate         Judge Elizabeth Laporte, following which she focused her practice on employment counseling and litigation.

Meet Our Founders
Kevin Hartz
Julia Hartz
Renaud Visage
Kevin
Hartz
Co-Founder
Before founding Eventbrite and serving as the company’s CEO for a decade,         Kevin was Co-Founder and CEO of Xoom Corporation, an international money transfer company         that went public and was acquired by PayPal in 2015. He has served as an early-stage investor and advisor        to successful start-ups including the likes of Airbnb, Pinterest, Uber, Lookout, Trulia,         Flixster, Skybox Imaging, and Yammer. Kevin has an undergraduate degree from Stanford University         and a master's degree from University College, Oxford.
Julia
Hartz
Co-Founder, Chief Executive Officer and Executive Chair
Julia is responsible for the vision, strategy, and growth of Eventbrite. Under         her leadership, the company has become the world’s largest event technology platform and has         received multiple awards for workplace culture. These accolades include Fortune's 100 Best Workplaces in         the U.S., Glassdoor's Employees' Choice Best Places to Work, and San Francisco Business Times' Best Places         to Work in the SF Bay Area. Julia has been honored as one of Inc.’s Female Founders 100, Fortune’s 40 Under         40 business leaders, Inc.’s 35 Under 35, and Fortune’s Most Powerful Women Entrepreneurs.
Renaud
Visage
Co-Founder
Renaud was Eventbrite's founding technical architect.         Trained as a civil engineer, Renaud joined the dot com world in 2009 as         Director of Engineering at photo-sharing pioneer Zing networks. In 2014, Renaud was recognized in         Wired UK's Top 100 digital influencers in Europe. He's also an active angel investor and mentor on         the European start-up scene. Renaud is also an accomplished architectural and travel photographer and         has had his work represented by various stock photo agencies around the world.

By
Clarity Relationships
Cultivating a space for singles who are financially stable & emotionally healthy with the desire to forge genuine connections/marriage.
Location
Online
Good to know
Highlights
2 hours
Online
About this event
Hobbies • Adult
We will hold scheduled private interviews via zoom (10-15 mins) that will be tastefully edited to showcase your best attributes. The video will then be uploaded to our Youtube channel dedicated to intentional love in order to increase your odds of finding lasting connection.
Check out current interviews at the link below to give you a better idea of the simple process. Also, be sure to subscribe and share with others in order to keep an eye out for intentional singles that may catch your attention.
https://www.youtube.com/@PreAndRae/videos
------------------
Have you ever wondered how you could help an amazing person in your life, find a person just as intentional and loving as they are? 🤔 You have grown tired
with
them after hearing about their dating challenges.
If that someone is
you
​--or someone you know: Let's connect on our YouTube channel! We have launched a new phase; from education & information to now highlighting
real
intentional singles 😎.
✨Mission: To create a space for persons who have high values, are financially stable, and are emotionally healthy with a desire to forge genuine connections.This space is for singles desiring marriage. You or your loved one must be legally single–not in the divorce process. Adults only, Ages 25+ preferred.
​
Serious inquiries only please
, if life happens and you cannot participate, please cancel your ticket to allow others an opportunity to book. Thank you!
🔍 Benefits?
Access to a pool of intentional singles
Tools and information
Opportunity to practice intentionally dating by filtering through potential love interests responding to their video
Embrace a platform designed for those seeking more than just casual encounters. We are building a new community and will be doing promo soon. Let's help you and those you love foster connections that align with thier life goals. Check our website (
www.clarityrelationships.com
) for more information about us. There is absolutely no expectation for you to purchase any of services unless you have the desire to do so.
Our goal is to build out a much needed space for authentically intentional singles.
📍 Location: [Virtual: Coordinators will contact you]
Ready to to find--or help someone you love journey towards intentional connections? Reserve your spot now!
---------------------------------------
Questions?: admin@clarityrelationships.com
Let's help build something meaningful together! 💖 #SeriousConnections #IntentionalDating #EventbriteEvent
Disclaimer:
Must be 21 and up and ready for a serious relationship. It is your responsibility to date cautiously. We do not assume responsibility for any events or outcomes that may occur if you elect to engage with individuals on or outside of our platform. Please be respectful: No curse words or foul language please.
Please note that we skew toward Christian conservative values. That said, we do not agree with all aforementioned values and fully believe that Christ absolutely loves everyone--even those who's values do not align with ours. Our policy is non discriminatory.
John 3:16 For God so loved the world, that he gave his only begotten Son, that whosoever believeth in him should not perish, but have everlasting life.
Lamentations 3:22–24 The steadfast love of the LORD never ceases; his mercies never come to an end; they are new every morning; great is your faithfulness. “The LORD is my portion,” says my soul, “therefore I will hope in him.”
Frequently asked questions
Whats next after I grab my ticket?
Coordinator will reach out to you directly via email to schedule interview date and time.
What does my payment count toward?
We've been there--and feel that it is missional for us to aid in elevating the dating process. We want to create a space for serious daters who are frustrated with dating games. We use contributions to aid in covering our single's promo costs.

Friday, September 26
Career Fair: Exclusive Tech Hiring Event-New Tickets Available
By
Tech Career Fair
Tech Career Fair focus on helping companies achieve their diversity and inclusivity initiative with more diverse non-traditional candidates
Date and time
Friday, September 26 · 9am - 12pm PDT
Location
Online
Good to know
Highlights
3 hours
Online
About this event
Business • Career
Tech Career Fair US/Canada
We will be hosting a virtual Tech Career Fair with our hiring partners from fast growing startups and Fortune 500 companies in technology in the US/Canada.  There will be a focus on helping companies achieve their diversity and inclusivity initiative with more diverse candidates to their talent pool. Available roles that our hiring companies are looking to fill are of the following:
Software Engineering
Product Management
Data Scientist
AI/Machine Learning Engineer
Data Analyst
UI/UX Design
Marketing
Sales
Steps:
Complete the Sign-up form
here
or the link below and upload your resume to the system to get your QR code/candidate profile link:
https://careerscrossroad.com/signup?code=TechCareerFair
Improve your profile while you are waiting for your profile to be approved
*
Completed and approved profiles will then be visible to different companies for each career fair where companies will then select who to send the invitation to attend their career fair with the next steps.
Follow the instructions in your email invitation from the employers and attend the career fair with your QR code/digital profile link with the hiring companies that you have been assigned to.
*Note:
This is an "invite-only" event due to limited space and high demand. Signing up on Eventbrite alone does not give you access to the event. You would still need to apply with the steps above for a potential invitation.  Only shortlisted candidates will then be notified for  the next steps on how  to attend. Please make sure you complete your profile as completely as you can and upload your resume to the platform for approval(If  the reviewer feels your profile is incomplete, they might not approve it in order to maintain the quality of candidates being presented to  the companies). Approval process timeline varies depending on  the backlog. Once approved, your profile will be visible and accessible to hiring partners and companies  on the platform. To increase your chances to be selected by one of our hiring companies and partners to one of the hiring events, it is recommended that you constantly refine and improve your profile.
Employers:
To reserve your spot
signup
here to get your company or get your company on the waitlist
here
for the next event and we will reach out to you with more info if we can slot you in.
